name: Cameras & Imaging Sensors
description: Sector template for camera module and imaging sensor patents including CMOS/CCD sensors, pixel architectures, and camera systems.
contextDescription: Camera and sensor patents cover the fundamental capture technology in all imaging devices. Key areas include CMOS pixel design, low-light performance, HDR imaging, autofocus systems, image stabilization, and multi-camera systems. Sony, Samsung, and OmniVision dominate the sensor market. Patents reading on mobile camera systems have enormous volume potential given billions of smartphones shipped annually.
scoringGuidance: CMOS pixel innovations (stacked sensors, dual-gain) are high-value given Sony/Samsung dominance.
Multi-camera and computational photography patents read on all flagship smartphones.
Low-light and HDR sensing innovations are key differentiators in the camera market.
Consider both sensor-level patents (pixel, array) and system-level patents (module, ISP integration).
Autofocus and stabilization patents have high infringement potential across device categories.

questions.question: At what level does this patent operate? Score: 1-3 for system-level only, 4-6 for module/integration, 7-10 for fundamental pixel/sensor architecture innovations.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify whether this is pixel-level, sensor-level, module-level, or system-level innovation.

questions.question: How relevant is this patent to smartphone camera systems? Consider multi-camera arrays, computational photography, low-light, and compact form factors.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Smartphone cameras are the highest-volume market. Assess relevance to flagship camera features.

questions.question: Does this patent improve HDR imaging or low-light performance? These are key differentiators in the camera market.
questions.reasoningPrompt: HDR and low-light are premium features. Assess the specific improvement offered.

questions.question: Does this patent address autofocus (PDAF, contrast-detect, laser) or image/optical stabilization? These are universal camera features.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Autofocus and OIS/EIS are in virtually all smartphone cameras. Assess infringement breadth.
